intro: Noronhia stevensiana, commonly known as the yellow star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its bulbs are used in traditional medicine, and it is valued for its ornamental appeal. Noronhia stevensiana is also cultivated in gardens for its vibrant color and ease of care.
